Once they fix it from being survivor sided, I'll change the review. Keeping in mind I'm not asking to swing the pendulum back to a killer sided scenario; just balance the fucking perks already.

Examples:
- Iron Will completely removes 1/2 of the audio/visual cues required to play, with unconditional 100% uptime, as well as being a total counter to Stridor (which was kinda "meh" anyway). 

- Now Boil Over has now gotten the same treatment as Iron Will, but now trashes on 3 killer perks; Agitation, Iron Grasp, and Mad Grit. 

- Survivors get to pick from 7 perk options to increase their movement speed depending on their need; Hope, Adrenaline, Balanced Landing, Lithe, Overcome, Smash Hit, and Sprint Burst. Most of these are completely viable as is. And yes, some of these are only effective in certain scenarios of a chase, but they're still an interactive part of the chase mechanic. Killers get 1; Play With Your Food, and they literally have to give up the chase to benefit from it, and isn't even an option if the obsession is dead. (Technically you could add the minor Hex: Devour Hope boost here, but let's get serious).
"But they're exhaustion perks, you generally only get to use them once in chase!", they may cry. You also get pallets, windows, jungle gyms, loops, lockers, flashlights, flash grenades, body blocking, and a speed boost if one hit doesn't down.

- Of the 9 Obsession based killer perks, 3 require the killer to ignore the obsession or get penalized. This requires tunneling, which supposedly is frowned up and discouraged, and so can be penalized further by super popular anti-tunneling perks like Borrowed Time and Decisive Strike. Also, 3 of those perks don't even effect the obsession or outright gives them bonuses.

- The new boon totems, while taking time away from generators for (potentially) just one person, can be INFINITELY replaced, STACK with each other on one totem, can be used on dull OR hex totems (with the latter being cleansed automatically in the process btw), and can be seen by ALL survivors ALL the time. Slap that shit on something like Hex: Ruin and NOED and I'll be a happy non-camping killer.

I could go on, but I really don't want to. Until then, enjoy getting rofl-stomped by shitty tea-baggers on crutches with no reason to respect the killer because it takes next to zero effort to escape now. I really couldn't care less about what 8 pro-players say about it either. I've known players to purposefully sandbag matches to reach lower brackets because it's more fun without having to professionally sweat all the time just to get a "GG" in the end game chat. This wasn't a "get gud" rant, it's a "get fair" one. Oh yeah, and the totally ineffective anti-cheat system. And then partake in this shit show for as long as it takes to farm an absolutely ludicrous amount of Blood Points to unlock 50 tiers worth of perks, THREE TIMES, for EACH CHARACTER to max tier. I'll give you a hint; it is still more than 460 hrs of playtime. And then have the developers beg for a "Labor Love" award or some shit on Steam. You know what, fuck this game.

I got a ton of hours, why? because when I first got this game years ago it was perfect.

But now.. Unbalanced, killer sided; rare to have a game where a killer or survivor dont say "gg ez" to eachother. t-bagging, camping, proxy camping. this game isn't played how it was made to be anymore.
And when calling someone out for being extremely shitty and not making the game fun for others, you're met with "you mad?" or "stay salty".

Your fellow survivors often throw you under the bus or leave you to die on hook. Killers tunnel you so all your games last about 5 minutes. The match making is currently broken and you get paired with those with lesser skill or greater skill than your own despite what BVHR claims it to be.

Survivor perks are met with nerfs while Killers get buffs. A NOED totem to make sure you die, another to make you exposed for up for 3 minutes. Perks that cover generators from the very beginning of the game for 5 minutes where all you can do is sit on your ass and not do anything until it goes away.

This game is full of toxic players who abuse the most OP perks. The devs again nerfed the only perk survivors really had to succeed (circle of healing) but decide to buff Plague so her mechanics aren't even worth doing anymore.
Blight and Freddy can slap you from across the map and the killers abuse that power.

In the couple days since the new rift started. I had exactly ONE game with a killer who played as intended. The rest made me want to uninstall because they manage to take away the entire gameplay from you.

Whatever killer complains this game is survivor sided must be new, because survivors never escape.

This review will change, if BVHR fixes how unbalanced, how insanely broken some killers are (AHEM, LEATHERFACE), how it's pointless for survivors to even try.

They wonder why their game is dying? they cater to the killers.
which statistically only about 30% of players play.

Once I get what I need from the rift, i'm off again.

Once VHS gets fully released, I guarantee most players will be jumping ship. I am one of them.

GENUINELY the worst purchase I've ever made.

(TL;DR: please do NOT buy this game.)

the only reason to buy this game is if you are a serious masochist or sadist.
and not even the fun kind, I'm talking like either someone who shoves toothpicks down their peeholes
or adults who poison their relatives' Halloween candy.

This game may seem like fun for the first few hours, but as it goes on you learn how fucking insidious the community is, 

you'll meet killers that are such assholes that they will go out of their way to ruin your day because you tried to have fun 
and brought a flashlight, (I'm a killer main I don't have much experience with bad killers). You'll meet survivors that will raid 
your discord server and call you slurs (true story) or go onto your profile and leave hateful things because you did 
something that they thought was "mean" or whatever. You may meet some cool friends but they will never stick in your 
mind as much as the bad apples.

 The devs are GENUINELY the most AWFUL people I've ever seen make a game. They go 
out of their way to not listen to their community, one of the main devs literally once said "if you don't like our game, go 
play something else". People at that time were complaining in mass that the game was just blatantly broken and one-sided. 

The devs play obvious favorites and have absolutely no clue what they're doing. Everything is overpriced, nothing is free. 

you get maybe like 5% of the game for the $20 you pay for it. you will then be forced to pay over $100 on DLCs and
 microtransactions. Most perks are locked behind DLCs and at any level of play beyond brand new you WILL need them to get ANYTHING out of this game. the battle pass is stupid grind-y, and so is the rest of the game. 1.3K hours in and I have barely any of my characters where I want them.

The matches come in one of two forms: mediocre or literally painful
The mediocre ones are normally ones that you win, a boring game where nothing cool happens and everyone leaves with points
the painful ones are the ones that will stick in your mind and make you a worse person.
It genuinely feels like I was back as being a kid and being the monkey in the middle with bullies throwing my toys over my head or something like that.

The core gameplay loop is literally, and I kid you not, running in circles.
whoever runs in circles better wins.
The skill in this game is arguable to not even really exist. 
for killers, the best you can do is master their power, which is much more skill-based than
survivor: pick good perks, run in circles good and bring your friends.
Neither of which are worth the pain of a bad game.

This game is based entirely around stun mechanics. Enough said.

This game is not a horror game. It never was a horror game, if anything, it is a horror adjacent game, and even that is arguable.
I fucking kid you not, the asymmetrical horror Roblox game "the stalker: reborn" is CONSIDERABLY more balanced then this giant heap of spaghetti and tangled earbuds. and that game is also scarier.
This game and it's devs don't know the first thing about horror.

The game has a chat filter (which never works in any game) to keep people from being assholes.
It does not keep people from being assholes, just keeps nice people from talking.
You can't say KILL in a game about KILLING PEOPLE
YOU CAN'T SAY BUTT
I DOUBT YOU COULD EVEN SAY FART
THIS GAME IS RATED M SO WHY THE **** ***'* * *** ****?

This game and its community will make you a worse person.

The devs are morons. They can't balance their game and they don't know what anyone wants, and they refuse to listen like stubborn children.
and like I said earlier, they seemingly go out of their way to NOT listen, case in point:

The reason I'm writing this review is simple, really.

They went too far.
They removed my favorite feature from one of my favorite killers
They removed leatherface's unlockable faces, pretty much the only fun thing to actually get in this godawful game

previously, if you killed 25 of the original 4 survivors as Leatherface you would get their face as a cosmetic
well, a bunch of dumbasses decided to use Claudette's face to be racist.

so what is the logical thing to do? remove that one face?
not do anything and just apologize?
fix the gamebreaking bugs they add in with every damn update?

nah, remove all the faces.

that was the last straw, and with that; I'm out.
Goodbye, DBD; and to the DBD community: Keep spending money on this awful company that doesn't care about you if you want, or join me and we can find an asymmetrical horror game that is actually a horror game and give THEM our money.
no ended my friendship and now my dad wont talking to me
Good game

As someone that played since before the PS4 launch, it's a bad horror movie for a new player:

- Too many perks split among every DLC survivor and killer (and only a few of them are the current meta).
- Every DLC survivor and killer needs to be leveled up to unlock the perks in the first place.
- Price of bloodweb items doesn't reflect the amount of bloodbonds you earn each match.
- Just like perks, most of the killer lineup isn't considered "meta" so the DLC is only used for perk picking.
- Internal MMR never degrades so a long enough break from the game sets you against streamer-quality opponents.
- The Boon Totems literally broke the Saloon map against the Killers.
- Game feels oddly Survivor sided overall.
- Hellraiser IP owners used the Pinhead model to shill NFTs.
- Netflix rescinded the Stranger Things license, so goodbye Demogorgon and Nancy/Steve cosmetics and their map.
- Matchmaking has always been a mess of grossly outranked survivors/killers, just feels like it's more blatant.
- Solo queue times are abysmal as Survivor with the cross-play on.
- Took them 4 years to put numbers in place of words for perk descriptions, 5 years for a colorblind mode (I don't know if it's even in there).
- When playing, either everyone tries to farm with you (thus ruining the battle pass objectives and progression) or they will kill you if you exist within the zip code. Even the survivors.
- There's a battle pass and it rewards you with lore?
- Players will tend to harass people that violate some made-up code of conduct if you don't play exactly how they want to be played against, so either get ready to block people or ignore it. Reporting in-game doesn't seem to do anything either, just so you know.

In short, if you enjoy grinding and/or have friends and plenty of cash, I still don't recommend it. Find something else that doesn't pit you against someone, like Deep Rock Galactic. Or Phasmophobia, if you want a horror experience.

I bought the game about a week or two ago, and while I really want to like the game, there are some really perplexing flaws that are materially ruining the experience for me. 

I've played mostly as killer, to give context, and since I started there have been some balance changes that encourage rampant trolling by survivors on some maps that ruin the game experience and have no real counterplay. Basically, survivors can equip certain abilities that make it impossible for the the vast majority of killers to actually kill them on some maps. These survivors will keep teabagging and running circles around you, and you'll be their captive until they graciously decide they've had their fun and complete the map to put you out of your misery. If you disconnect, you'll be penalized. Oh, and the survivors have the ability to force the game into the impacted maps if they want. 

In addition to this, the game has terrible ultrawide monitor support. It uses a Vert- approach, which means that if you have an ultrawide monitor you have the same horizontal FOV as you would if you had a 16:9 aspect ratio monitor, and about a third less vertical FOV. There are no settings to change the FOV for the game to resolve this issue. 

I've read speculation that this is because of a concern that giving ultrawide monitor users a wider FOV would be an unfair advantage. I'm skeptical of this argument given ultra competitive games like Counterstrike allow FOV manipulation, but even if that is the concern simply hobbling the FOV of ultrawide monitor users seems like an obviously hypocritical and awful solution. A better approach would be pillarboxing, but after some research it seems this problem isn't a priority for the developers. 

All in all, I would suggest spending your money elsewhere, ESPECIALLY if you use an ultrawide monitor.

I... wanna like this game. I want to like it a lot. But it has changed. The devs have gotten antagonistic to their player base, are actively punishing content creators for giving them reasonable criticism and are turning the game from something fun to something that induces misery, win or lose. I hope they'll snap out of it, but until they do, I won't be spending another cent on it. At the end of the day, games are supposed to be fun and they are doing all they can to remove what fun there is.

edit: It... looks like they've finally caught on. They've been making positive changes, improving the experience and seem to be trying to make the game better. I don't know what happened, maybe new employees, maybe they're allowed to make more changes, can't say. Still, it's more positive now and I actually came back and started playing again.

Almost at 3000 hours. Yes there were some fun times. But I spent more time trying to like this game than actually liking it. My main motivation for playing this game was because I loved the idea of a technical hide/seek game along with wanting a break from first person shooters.

I took a break from DBD and have gone back a couple times recently only to remember why I put it down in the first place. The game is just simply not that fun, regardless of skill level.

There also ALWAYS seems to be a killer or two who is way overpowered, no matter how much game balancing is done.

Recommended or not isn't really fair here. This isn't my flavor of game but it's not bad if it's your cup of tea. Good fun with friends but i don't seek it out on my own. 

There is a heavy social contract that i find difficult to understand and follow. It is wholly pvp based 1 killer vs up to 4 survivors. Each player gets to pick a character that serves as a class of sorts, each with their own perks and styles of play. That being said there seems to be little difference between survivor choices and games seem to be heavily weighted in the favor of survivors except in a the case of a few killers, all of which are either behind a paywall or an extended personal experience wall, the game is easy enough to play but hard to master. When i do play i tend to only play with a group of friends and match their vibe, be it making friends with the killer or being as tactical as possible or anything in between.
whats fun about it is the cooperativeness.

So, six anniversary is going now, for 6 years, for 2191 days we still don't have:
 - No normal graphic settings, u can't litteraly disable FXAA in settings that makes ur game looks like shit even on ultra settings, btw no ANY other anti-alliasing options. Settings higher then low enables ambient occlusion and ur game looks darker...
 - No brightness/gamma settings, for the ones who gonna say dbd is horror, u have less than 20 hours or u are brainded, u can adjust ur gamma in windows, in GPU settings, in windows calibration settings, on monitor, BUT NO, WE ARE NOT GONNA ADD A SINGLE fkin gamma slider to the game
 - No option to disable after game chat, like if u are fighting against toxicity/hate speech why u can't just add a fking option??
 - No option to chage ressolution, aspect ratio, fov, it's just fucking dumb, killing 4:3 resollution and forcing everyone to use 16:9 is a fucking dumb, it's not about balance, it's about behavior being lazy fucks
 - FPS lock at 60, it's just a fking shame...
 - Input helper (or how do u call it in english), dude i know if im gonna press m1 im gonna repair generator, i know if im gonna press space im gonna jump over the pallet, just let me disable it, it don't want more sings on my screen

And of course there is a million annoying things that bhvr didn't fix for 6 years, maniac auto-aim that fucks u at least once per day, bug with super fast vaults, bug with silent vault, bug when injured survivors doesnt't make any noice. Slow menu animation, blood web up tooks so long for no reason cuz of super slow animations.

Can't say much about balance, they are finally doing something, game is still super toxic and buggy, not gonna return until they gonna alow us to use castom uspect ratio, not recommended to but this shitty game.
